qwirkle.gamelogic

Class Lobby

  • java.lang.Object
    • qwirkle.gamelogic.Lobby

  • public class Lobby
extends java.lang.Object
    When a client enters the server, it is placed in a lobby. These lobbies have a fixed size, to prevent overloaded lobbies. When a lobby is full a new lobby will be created, and the client will be placed there. The lobby handles searching for a matching game and will start it when found.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Lobby(Server server)
      Lobby constructor creates a lobby, and takes a server object for communication.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClient(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Add client to the lobby.
      void addGame(Game game)
      Keep track of all games running in this lobby.
      void checkForGame()
      Looks at all connected clients if there is a matching game, if so it starts it.
      void endGame(Game game)
      After game was terminated, remove it from the lobby.
      void gameStarted()
      Let server know a game has started.
      Game getGame(ClientHandler client)
      Getter for game objects, can be fetch by clientHandler.
      boolean hasClient(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Checks if this lobby has a certain client.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Check if lobby is empty.
      boolean isFull()
      Check if lobby is already full.
      void removeClient(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Remove client from internal lobby list and from game if it is in-game.
      void removeClientFromLobby(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Removes client from lobby, for example when game is started, or client disconnected.
      void startGame(java.util.ArrayList<ClientHandler> clients)
      Start a new game, using the clients provided as parameter.
